comments:
3.2 M5

Trying to connect to dev.eclipse.org using pserverssh2 (was getting connection refused using pserver, wanted to see what pserverssh2 was for), I got the NPE below.

Steps:

1) New > Import...
2) CVS > Projects from CVS
3) paste the following location in the "Host" text field:

:pserverssh2:anonymous@dev.eclipse.org:/home/eclipse

4) Next
5) Choose "Use an existing module" - NPE happens.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh2.PServerSSH2ServerConnection.open(PServerSSH2ServerConnection.java:114)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.Connection.open(Connection.java:128)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.CVSRepositoryLocation.createConnection(CVSRepositoryLocation.java:532)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.CVSRepositoryLocation.openConnection(CVSRepositoryLocation.java:773)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.client.Session.open(Session.java:152)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.CVSRepositoryLocation.validateConnection(CVSRepositoryLocation.java:990)
	at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ui.wizards.ModuleSelectionPage$2.run(ModuleSelectionPage.java:162)
	at org.eclipse.jface.operation.ModalContext$ModalContextThread.run(ModalContext.java:113)
We should guard against the NPE. I suspect the problem is that the pserverssh2 connection method needs additional authentication info in the location string.
